modules.description: This module handles text formatting and output generation with customizable styles, colors, and layout elements. It provides functions for creating labeled output lines, calculating text width, sanitizing strings, and generating accessible text combinations. Concrete use cases include building styled terminal output with optional counters, icons, and scaled text in a formatter.

Handles rendering and conversion of icon data. It provides a pretty-printing function for formatting icons with optional labels and coordinates, and a conversion function from strings to optional values. This module is useful for visualizing icons in a formatted output or parsing icon representations from text.

Represents formatting styles for output, with `Classic` and `Flat` variants. Converts string values to corresponding style types using `of_string`. Used to control layout in command-line output generation.

This module defines a set of common color values and supports conversion from strings to these colors. It includes operations for pretty-printing colors and parsing string representations into color values. Use this module when handling color codes in terminal output or configuration files.

A module containing a single value `table`, which is an array of floating-point numbers. It is designed for direct access to a predefined set of numerical values, suitable for applications requiring static data lookup or mathematical processing. Example use cases include storing precomputed constants, coefficients for calculations, or fixed-size datasets for analysis.

This module combines text formatting, styling, and data rendering capabilities for generating structured terminal output. It supports customizable styles like `Classic` and `Flat`, color manipulation with string conversion, and icon rendering with optional labels. The text formatting functions allow creating labeled lines, calculating widths, and sanitizing strings, while the icon and color modules enable visual element parsing and representation. You can generate styled output with icons and colors, process string-encoded visual elements, or access predefined numerical data for calculations.
